content.description: Climb a slab into a right-facing dihedral. Pull over on the arete to finish.
content.protection: Sling a boulder on top, and use cracks to directionally support your anchor.
content.location:
It is the small floating roof and dihedral on the left (south) side of

Flounder

on the southern end of the east side of Magic Kingdom. This is south and uphill of

Chiminey Cricket

.

content.description: Start by reaching high to a jug. Get established on the first bulge, and follow the bolts past a few interesting slab moves. This is a great beginner lead.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with no rap rings, Do an easy scramble off climber's right.
content.location: It is the first bolted route you will encounter when approaching Magic Kingdom from The Stacks, and is on the corner of the large smooth slab immediately left of the big dead tree.

content.description: This somewhat featureless and vague looking face yields to a handful of sustained and classic moves. Scramble up, and clip the first bolt from the left, utilizing the arete or stickclip it, then pull right onto the face. Climb through thin, vertical face utilizing the high right arete after the last bolt with a few final moves left to gain the hole, and clip the anchor. The right-leaning crimps midway are a bit creaky and suspect but seem to hold bodyweight fine.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. Rap or scramble off.
content.location:
It is the bolted line right of

Chiminey Cricket

.

content.description: Climb clean hands cracks to a right-facing corner/flake. Finish on creaky and suspect jugs. This could probably go free on gear.
content.protection: Sling a boulder on top, and use cracks to place a piece of pro for directional support.
content.location:
Just around the right (north) side of

Flounder's

face, ocate hand cracks running up a clean slab.

content.description: This is a quick and easy way to access the top of the small cliff to set up TR anchors. Scramble up the broken corner with some good rock on the right. There is one weird move near the top, choosing between some suspect options. Pull down, not out! You can walk off with a bit of easier scrambling to your left (south) from the top.
content.protection: This is a short scramble. If you want an easier way up, head left (south) of the Dumbo wall, and locate a line of weakness through the boulders to the top (used as the walkoff if not downclimbing the corner).
content.location:
It is the corner uphill above

Space Mountain

and right of the Dumbo wall.

content.description: Scramble up some trivial slab to the small, imposing headwall. Take the less steep crack on the left to the top.
content.protection: The FA was solo, but this could be protected with a cam or two, hands/fist size, I think. There are lots of gear and natural anchor options on top.
content.location: It can be seen from the road on the west face of Magic Kingdom. Find the easiest way up the slab to reach the headwall above, and take the short left crack.

content.description: Pick a line of crimps and jugs, and head to the top. Starting right on the layback crimps is slightly harder.
content.protection: Sling a boulder on top for TR.
content.location:
It is on the east face, just north and downhill of the Dumbo wall, or head south and uphill from

Chiminey Cricket

.

content.description: Climb the perfect and eye-catching hands crack to a crumbly, lichen covered exit.
content.location:
This ascends the obvious, arching crack in the right-facing corner visible on your right (south) approaching past The Stacks from the road. It is in the corner right of the dead tree next to

Simba Slab

.

content.description: Start on the thin, left-angling crack. Climb through another thin, left-angling fingers/tips crack to jugs, and layback crystals above.
content.protection: Scramble up and sling a boulder for a TR anchor.
content.location:
It is just uphill and south of

Space Mountain

.

content.description: Fun opening moves lead to a large ledge beneath a short, overhung handcrack.
content.protection: Scramble to the top, and sling a large boulder for a TR anchor.
content.location:
On the south end of the crag on an east face in a small recessed area, this is just south of and above

Space Mountain

.

content.description: Start on the thin, left-angling crack, climb straight up, and exit slightly left directly through the overhanging face.
content.protection: Scramble on top and sling a boulder for TR anchor.
content.location:
It is just uphill and south of

Space Mountain

.

content.description: Start with trivial scrambling into the wide base, pick a side, and joyfully wedge upward past hidden holds to a spinning exit through a very short handcrack.
content.protection: Sling a giant boulder for the anchor. The crack tends to hold the anchor position quite nicely. It could definitely go on big gear.
content.location:
Locate

Elephantiasis

, and look for a faint, cairned trail heading southeast toward the large, reddish formation. Follow around the base, and a large, low angle slab will lead you to a corner with this wide crack.
